perturbation.original_text: The object of the Affiliate Program provided by element 5 (hereafter, "Program") is to publish electronic advertisements on the Web site of the Affiliate for selected software products offered by element 5 Software Publishers. Instead of fixed compensation, the Affiliate receives result- dependent Advertising Cost Compensation (also known in the element 5 Control Panel as "Commission") in exchange for publishing the advertisements.
perturbation.changed_text: The object of the Affiliate Program provided by element 5 (hereafter, "Program") is to publish electronic advertisements on the Web site of the Affiliate for selected software products offered by element 5 Software Publishers. Instead of fixed compensation, the Affiliate receives result- dependent Advertising Cost Compensation (also known as 'Bonus') in exchange for publishing the advertisements.
perturbation.explanation: The original text defines Advertising Cost Compensation as "Commission". The modified text redefines the same term as 'Bonus'. This creates an internal contradiction, leading to uncertainty in enforcement if the contract later refers to 'Commission' or 'Bonus'.
perturbation.location: I. Object of the Affiliate Program/ Affiliate Management Program for Software Publishers

perturbation.original_text:
(1) element 5 shall record and compute on a monthly basis the amount of said Advertising Cost Compensation for the Affiliate.
(4) The computation basis for determining the value of the Advertising Cost Compensation is calculated by the gross sales price (including taxes, shipping and handling, etc.) actually invoiced to the referred end user. The percentage of the respective Advertising Cost Compensation shall be stipulated by the Software Publisher, but shall not exceed 50% of the effective gross sales price of the software.
perturbation.changed_text:
(1) element 5 shall record and compute on a monthly basis the amount of said Advertising Cost Compensation for the Affiliate.
(4) The computation basis for determining the value of the Partner Payment is calculated by the net sales price of the software. The percentage of the respective Advertising Cost Compensation shall be at the sole discretion of Element 5.
perturbation.explanation: The original text defines the computation basis for 'Advertising Cost Compensation' as calculated by the 'gross sales price' and stipulated by 'Software Publisher'. The modified text introduces 'Partner Payment' calculated by 'net sales price' and the percentage is at the 'sole discretion of Element 5.' This contradiction can lead to financial disagreements between parties.
perturbation.location: II. Affiliate Program ยง 6 Advertising Cost Compensation

perturbation.original_text: Affiliate is only eligible to earn the Advertising Cost Compensation on sales occurring during the term of this Agreement and fees earned up to the date termination will remain payable only if the related orders are not cancelled or returned. If the Advertising Cost Compensation was previously paid by element 5, it can be offset or invoiced to Affiliate at element 5's own discretion.
perturbation.changed_text: Affiliate is only eligible to earn the Advertising Cost Compensation on sales occurring during the term of this Agreement, and those fees may be withheld at the discretion of Element 5. Any payments previously made are considered non-refundable.
perturbation.explanation: The original text states that fees earned up to the date of termination will remain payable if related orders are not cancelled. The modified text contradicts this by stating that those fees may be withheld and any payments are non-refundable, creating uncertainty about payment terms upon termination.
perturbation.location: ยง 8 Termination of the agreement
